Description: Green-blue glazed composition amulet in the form of a double-sided wedjat-eye, with design engraved before firing, and pierced lengthwise.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, North-west Ptolemaic mound ? (?)
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but probably from Tell Dafana or Tell Nabasha, according to the context of the item in the list. If from Tell Dafana, possibly one of the 4 "eyes" among the "glazed pottery amulets of late work, probably late Ptolemaic", from the North-west mound, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 79. See also London BM, EA 18456, 18511, and 18547, similar in style.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 79) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49, p.59, p.60, p.179, pl.21)
